      • bubbleSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void bubbleSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                          int n)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Bubble Sort algorithm: theArray is sorted into ascending order.
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of items of the array to sort
        theArray - is an array of n items.

      • insertionSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void insertionSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                             int n)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Insertion Sort Algorithm.
        Parameters:
        n - is the size of the array to sort
        theArray - is an array of n items.

      • mergeSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void mergeSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                         int first,
                                                                         int last)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Merge Sort algorithm. The algorithm will sort the array between the indices first and last.
        Parameters:
        first - is the index of the first element to sort
        last - is the index of the last element to sort
        theArray - is the array to sort Calls: merge.

      • quickSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void quickSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                         int first,
                                                                         int last)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Quick Sort algorithm
        Parameters:
        first - is the index of the first element to sort with first <= last.
        last - is the index of the last element to sort with first <= last.
        theArray - is the array to be sorted: the element between first and last (with first <= last)will be sorted. Calls: partition.

      • selectionSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void selectionSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                             int n)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Selection Sort algorithm.
        Parameters:
        n - is the size of the array to sort
        theArray - is an array of n items. Calls: indexOfLargest.

      • shellSort

        public static <E extends java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> void shellSort(E[] theArray,
                                                                         int n)
        Sorts the items in an array into ascending order using the Shell Sort algorithm.
        Parameters:
        n - is the size of the array to sort
        theArray - is an array of n items.

      • radixSort

        public static void radixSort(java.lang.Integer[] Q,
                             int numdigits,
                             int numbase)
        Sorts an array of Integer in ascending order using Radix Sort.
        Parameters:
        Q - is the array of Integer to sort.
        numdigits - is the maximum number of digits of any number in the array Q.
        numbase - is the base of the number.

      • radix

        public static void radix(java.lang.Integer[] Q,
                         int k,
                         int numdigits,
                         int numbase)
        performs one pass of the radix sort algorithm: the method sorts the number contained in Q by increasing value of the kth digit, and makes a recursive calls to the next column when necessary. This implementation relies on queues.
        Parameters:
        Q - contains the Integer to sort.
        k - is the position of the digits (from right to left)that we are considering for this pass of radix sort.
        numdigits - maximal number of digits of any number in Q
        numbase - base of the integer.

      • getKthNumber

        public static int getKthNumber(java.lang.Integer num,
                               int k,
                               int numbase)
        find the kth digit of the specified number written in a specified base
        Parameters:
        num - is the number considered
        k - is the position of the digit we want to know (from the right)
        numbase - is the base used to write num (ex base 10).
